Private Member Functions

 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (NinePatchDrawer)

Detailed Description

A resizeable bitmap, with stretchable areas that you define.

This type of image is defined in a .png file with a special format.

Definition at line 30 of file NinePatchDrawer.h.

virtual void gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::draw ( Canvas *  canvas) [virtual]

Draw in its bounds (set via setBounds) respecting optional effects such as alpha (set via setAlpha) and color filter (set via setColorFilter).

Parameters:
canvasThe canvas to draw into

Return the intrinsic height of the underlying Drawer object.

Returns -1 if it has no intrinsic height, such as with a solid color.

Return the intrinsic width of the underlying Drawer object.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

int32_t gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::getMinimumHeight ( ) const [virtual]

Returns the minimum height suggested by this Drawer.

If a View uses this Drawer as a background, it is suggested that the Widget use at least this value for its height. (There will be some scenarios where this will not be possible.) This value should INCLUDE any padding.

Returns:
The minimum height suggested by this Drawer. If this Drawer doesn't have a suggested minimum height, 0 is returned.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

int32_t gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::getMinimumWidth ( ) const [virtual]

Returns the minimum width suggested by this Drawer.

If a View uses this Drawer as a background, it is suggested that the Widget use at least this value for its width. (There will be some scenarios where this will not be possible.) This value should INCLUDE any padding.

Returns:
The minimum width suggested by this Drawer. If this Drawer doesn't have a suggested minimum width, 0 is returned.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

int32_t gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::getOpacity ( ) const [virtual]

Return the opacity/transparency of this Drawer.

Generally a Drawer should be as conservative as possible with the value it returns. For example, if it contains multiple child drawers and only shows one of them at a time.

Note that the returned value does not take into account a custom alpha that has been applied by the client through the setAlpha methods.

Returns:
int32_t The opacity class of the Drawer.

Implements gaia::graphics::Drawer.

bool gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::getPadding ( Rect *  padding) const [virtual]

Return in padding the insets suggested by this Drawer for placing content inside the drawer's bounds.

Positive values move toward the center of the Drawer (set Rect::inset). Returns true if this drawer actually has a padding, else false. When false is returned, the padding is always set to 0.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

virtual Paint* gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::newPaint ( ) const [virtual]

Returns the paint used to render this drawer.

Developer needs to delete the pointer by self.

Reimplemented in gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawerPlus.

void gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::setAlpha ( int32_t  alpha) [virtual]

Specify an alpha value for the drawer.

0 means fully transparent, and 255 means fully opaque.

Implements gaia::graphics::Drawer.

virtual void gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::setColorFilter ( const ColorFilter *  cf) [virtual]

Specify an optional colorFilter for the drawer.

Pass null to remove any filters.

Implements gaia::graphics::Drawer.

Reimplemented in gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawerPlus.

void gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::setDither ( bool  dither) [virtual]

Set to true to have the drawer dither its colors when drawn to a device with fewer than 8-bits per color component.

This can improve the look on those devices, but can also slow down the drawing a little.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

void gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::setFilterBitmap ( bool  filter) [virtual]

Set to true to have the drawer filter its bitmap when scaled or rotated (for drawers that use bitmaps).

If the drawer does not use bitmaps, this call is ignored. This can improve the look when scaled or rotated, but also slows down the drawing.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

void gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer::setTargetDensity ( const Canvas *  canvas)

Set the density scale at which this drawer will be rendered.

This method assumes the drawer will be rendered at the same density as the specified canvas.

Parameters:
canvasThe Canvas from which the density scale must be obtained.
